description: Smallest number to give 2^(2n) in a hailstone (3x + 1) sequence.
comments: In hailstone sequences, only even powers of 2 are obtained as a final peak before descending to 1.For n>1, the bisection of A010120. For n=3,6,7,9,12,15,16,18,19,21, we have a(n)=(4^n-1)/3, the largest possible value because one 3x+1 step produces 2^(2n). [From _T. D. Noe_, Feb 19 2010]
references: J. Heleen, Final Peak Sequences for Hailstone Numbers, 1993, preprint.
formula: For n > 1: a(n) = A070167(A000302(n)). -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 02 2013
prog: (Haskell)a054646 1 = 1a054646 n = a070167 $ a000302 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 02 2013
author: _Jeff Heleen_, Apr 16 2000
